text:
Groovy groovy-1.0-jsr-03 seems to require antlr to be in the ANT classpath and
this dependency is not listed in the dependencies list. Easy to discover and
solve, just an FYI.
I ran ANT on Windows but assume that the problem persists on any OS.
creator: gverig@yahoo.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
This is actually an improvement; I think previous releases included the antlr
libs in the JAR, which actually complicates managing antlr versions.

agreed, something to add to the docs.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
Also, would(n't) using the groovy embeddable jar solve the problem?  AFAICT it
has dependencies included in jarjar'ed packages.
Questions to our Groovy Guys - to update or not to update? ;-)
creator: jan@materne.de
peterreilly@apache.org
text: Committed the change, thanks for the report.
